name: Himachali Dham
description: In Himachal Pradesh, dham is a traditional mid-day meal made and eaten during rituals such as marriages, family gatherings, and religious occasions.

name: Babru
description: Babru is made differently and has a distinctive flavour, despite having a similar appearance to the kachoris sold in North India.You won't want regular kachoris again once you've had babru.

name: Kullu's Trout Fish
description: This non-vegetarian speciality is a must-try in Himachal Pradesh if you enjoy eating fish.In order to add taste, the fish is pan-fried in mustard oil and then drizzled with a simple lemon-onion sauce.

name: Bhel
description: Lotus stems are chopped into pieces and fried with ginger, garlic, onion, gramme flour, and a variety of spices to make bhey,which has a mouthwatering flavour.

name: Siddu
description: Siddu is a must-try for everyone visiting Himachal Pradesh as it is one of the state's most adored traditional dishes.which is then filled with fat and baked. It is the way it is prepared that makes it more unique and delicious.
